name: MAS Boston Society
mission: Tarbiya Department Tarbiya aims at rooting the faith, purifying the soul, expanding and refining knowledge/understanding, developing and refining all aspects of character, boosting commitment, building skills, and instilling the discipline necessary to conduct a successful, fulfilling, meaningful, and balanced life of learning, virtue, commitment, and service of Islam and humanity.
theoryOfChange: The Muslim American Society (MAS), of which MAS Boston is a chapter, publishes an "Our Impact Areas" framework on its national website. This framework outlines five key focus areas: Islam for Muslims, Leadership Development, Community Mobilization, Social Justice, and Islam to NonMuslims. For each focus area, the framework details specific "Subareas of Focus" and measurable "Outcomes." For example, under "Islam for Muslims," subareas include Develop, Produce, and Distribute, with outcomes such as "Knowledge" and "Behavior." This structured approach describes how their activities are intended to lead to desired impact.

grantsData.purpose: MONEY COLLECTED AS PART OF ZAKAT (AN EXPECTATION IN THE MUSLIM FAITH THAT ALL FINANCIALLY STABLE MUSLIMS PAY MONEY TOWARDS HELPING NEEDY INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY) IS GIVEN TO THE ISLAMIC CIRCLE OF NORTH AMERICA (ICNA) RELIEF, WHO THEN DISTRIBUTES THIS MONEY BASED ON AN APPLICATION AND REVIEW PROCESS TO NEEDY INDIVIDUALS.

PAYMENT TO ISB (A RELIGOUS ORGANIZATION) FOR ISB TO PAYDOWN LOAN WHICH WAS USED TO FINANCE THE CONTRUCTION OF THE ISLAMIC SOCIETY OF BOSTON CULTURAL CENTER (THE CENTER). THIS IS CONSISTENT WITH THE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT BETWEEN MAS BOSTON AND ISB FOR THE CENTER.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 33/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston earns 63/100 due to good alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The charity is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
The organization's profile metadata and financial efficiency metrics are tracked here.
The organization provides multiple donation options and methods for supporters.
MAS Boston reported total revenue of $3,286,832 and operates programs including Tarbiya, PACE, and Youth Development.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates solid financial efficiency and strong alignment with religious giving requirements, though its overall score is moderated by moderate data confidence and limited working capital reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with only 3.2 months of working capital available.
Transparency could be enhanced through more recent publicly available impact reporting.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE entity with clear pathways for religious giving [1][3]. Its focus on youth development and civic engagement addresses urgent cultural and religious needs within the Boston community [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: MAS Boston demonstrates a high commitment to its mission by directing 85.3% of its $3,286,832 total revenue toward functional programs [4]. While the organization shows high efficiency in fundraising, its impact score reflects a focus on capacity building and spiritual development, which are vital but often lack standardized third-party impact metrics [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the local community through comprehensive spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement programs.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.3%, indicating a strong commitment to direct service delivery.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.05 per $1 raised.
Diverse programming spanning youth development, public affairs, and religious education.
baseline_narrative.summary: MAS Boston is a non-profit organization dedicated to 'Tarbiya,' a holistic approach to spiritual and character development aimed at fostering service to Islam and humanity [4]. The organization is recognized as ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE, maintaining a dedicated policy to distribute funds according to established asnaf categories [1].

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for Muslim donors due to its <cite id="1">verified zakat-eligibility</cite> and focus on <cite id="1">asnaf categories like the poor and needy</cite>.

credibility.explanation: MAS Boston establishes trust through a <cite id="4">strong board governance structure</cite> and transparent reporting of <cite id="4">officer compensation totaling $91,461</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To enhance credibility, the organization should <cite id="2">publish annual impact reports</cite> that include verified beneficiary statistics.

impact.explanation: The organization is highly efficient, with an <cite id="4">85.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="2">3.4-month working capital reserve</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact scores could improve by <cite id="2">tracking and reporting specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to invest in long-term Islamic character building and youth leadership within the American Muslim community through a financially efficient organization.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through a local community hub
Value high program-to-expense ratios and lean fundraising
Believe in the 'Tarbiya' model of spiritual and civic development
Support the strengthening of local Islamic institutions through grants
giving_considerations: Donations support a broad range of programs rather than a single project
The organization focuses on capacity building which has long-term rather than immediate results
Detailed impact metrics like cost-per-student are not currently available
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking rigorous, third-party academic evidence of impact or those looking for international emergency relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has a clear theory of change but <cite id="2">lacks external evaluations</cite> or multi-year outcome tracking data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAS Boston utilizes a <cite id="4">Tarbiya-based model</cite> to develop individuals who are spiritually grounded and socially responsible.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that spiritual and leadership programs are effectively translating into community service.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="4">$3.3M revenue base</cite> and expanding programs, the organization has significant capacity to absorb more funding for its PACE and Youth initiatives.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">86.0% of its budget toward direct services</cite>, exceeding the <cite id="2">peer program ratio median of 81.7%</cite>.
MAS Boston maintains a lean development operation, spending only <cite id="2">$0.05 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity has demonstrated financial resilience with a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 13.4%</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: MAS Boston's financial health is anchored by a strong program expense ratio that consistently outperforms industry standards. By dedicating <cite id="4">86.0% of its $3,083,919 in total expenses</cite> to its core mission, the organization ensures that donor contributions are utilized for direct community impact. Furthermore, its grantmaking capacity allows it to strengthen the broader ecosystem, as seen in its <cite id="4">$125,000 grant to the Islamic Society of Boston</cite>. This efficiency is coupled with a <cite id="2">working capital ratio of 3.4 months</cite>, providing a stable financial cushion for its ongoing operations in the Boston area.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston serves as a vital hub for spiritual and character development within the New England Muslim community. The organization operates through a holistic 'Tarbiya' framework, which aims at <cite id="4">rooting the faith and purifying the soul</cite> to develop committed community leaders. With <cite id="4">$3,286,832 in total revenue</cite>, MAS Boston manages a diverse portfolio of programs including <cite id="2">youth development, public affairs, and religious education</cite>. The organization demonstrates high operational efficiency, allocating <cite id="4">86.0% of its total expenses to program services</cite>. This financial discipline is further evidenced by its fundraising strategy, which costs only <cite id="2">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite>. Beyond its internal programs, MAS Boston acts as a community pillar by providing significant financial support to other institutions, including <cite id="4">$154,532 in domestic grants</cite> to partners like the Islamic Society of Boston. The charity is <cite id="1">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, maintaining a policy to distribute funds to categories such as <cite id="1">the poor (fuqara) and the needy (masakin)</cite>.
